title: Create an asset model record
content:
1. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration.

  2. From SACM Home, select Asset Models.

    • In the table view, click New.

    • In the tree view, click Add an Asset Model.

  3. In the New Asset Model dialog box, provide all requested information. This dialog requests values for the basic model attributes.

    Field Description
    Model Type

    The asset type to which this model may be applied. For example, Device.
    Device subtype

    Mandatory. The subtype of the asset.

    Available when: The model type is Device.
    License metric

    Mandatory. The license metric associated with the asset.

    Available when: The model type is License.
    Infrastructure & Peripheral subtype

    Mandatory. The subtype of the asset.

    Available when: The model type is Infrastructure & Peripheral.
    Service subtype

    Mandatory. The subtype of the asset.

    Available when: The model type is Service.
    Enterprise asset subtype

    Mandatory. The subtype of the asset.

    Available when: The model type is Enterprise Asset.
    Process type

    Type of the enterprise asset process, including Full Ownership, Consumable, and Stationary. 

    Available when: The model type is Enterprise Asset.
    Batch

    Select this option if you want assets created from this model to be managed collectively instead of individually.

    Available when: The process type is Consumable.
    Display label Mandatory. External (common) name of the asset model.
    UOM

    The unit of measure of the individual assets in the asset model. 

    Available when: The Batch option is selected.
    UNSPSC Code

    Relevant UNSPSC code.
    Brand

    Brand of the asset model.
    Parent model

    Parent model of the selected asset model record.

    In the tree view, this field is hidden and automatically populated with the currently selected model.
    Owner Owner of the asset model.
    Cost type Type of cost. For example, hardware maintenance or software.
    Category

    If you select this option, the asset model is a category. This enables you to categorize a grouping of models in one theme.

    • If selected, this record doesn't appear as a selectable asset model for assets.

    • If not selected, this record does appear as a selectable asset model for assets.

  4. Click   Save on the toolbar.

  • Asset models
  • How to view asset model records
